article: hillary rodham clinton -- reinvigorated by big campaign saving primary wins -- hinted wednesday she would accept barack obama as her democratic vice presidential running mate , but braced for stiffer challenges from a rival still ahead in the all-important delegate count .
abstract: clinton hints at sharing ticket with obama but nomination must be decided first
